item.title: The Legend Of Neverland Codes (October 2024)
item.description:
The Legend Of Neverland is an anime-based adventure RPG with an open world filled with lots of mysteries, enemies, and bosses. To be ready for unexpected adventures, obstacles, and other dangers, you will need to improve your character, which requires a lot of time and effort.

By redeeming The Legend Of Neverland codes, you can greatly simplify the process of farming resources, currency, and other things because you will receive them directly as rewards. Below is a collection of working codes that you can use, so don't delay as they do eventually expire.

All The Legend Of Neverland Codes

Working The Legend Of Neverland Codes

  • WitBroom - Redeem this code to get Witch Broom.

Expired The Legend Of Neverland Codes

  • TLON2nd
  • SOFT2ND
  • CHMPGLB
  • DADLUV24
  • KidJoy
  • MOMLUV24
  • LABOR24
  • JEST2024
  • AF0401
  • Bunnies
  • MASHUDAY
  • HEROINES
  • Dragon
  • Hi2024
  • TLON2024
  • XMAS2023
  • TLONPC
  • TYVM2023
  • Trick4U
  • Pumpkin
  • WitBroom
  • MOONTLON
  • FullMoon
  • OneYear
  • SoftOpen
  • SMR2023
  • Peak717
  • FDay2023
  • HappyKid
  • HBD520
  • MDay2023
  • MayDay
  • EASTER23
  • Y1Thanks
  • MiruFool
  • WhiteDay
  • Holi2023
  • We50Kool
  • Love2023
  • LNY2023
  • Year2023
  • colorful
  • XmasGift
  • survey01
  • survey02
  • autosurv
  • VelRider!
  • arigatou
  • ClownSet
  • BlackCat
  • 1mDNLD
  • TLON2022
  • HAHA0401
  • Treat4U
  • Forever
  • WithYou
  • Love100
  • 3MCode
  • Home02
  • Home01
  • VIP999focus111

Redeeming The Legend Of Neverland codes is always useful, especially from the very beginning of the game. So, if you are a beginner, an inactive player, or simply don't have the resources or want to replenish them, redeem the working codes to get your rewards.

How to Redeem Codes for The Legend Of Neverland

Redeeming The Legend Of Neverland codes will take you a few seconds, and what's more, you can do it right after you launch the game, even ignoring the tutorial, which is not that common for mobile games. If you don't know or understand how the The Legend Of Neverland redemption system works, here is a detailed guide:

  • Launch The Legend Of Neverland .
  • Pay attention to the upper right part of the screen. Here, to the left of the mini-map, you will find the hamburger button. Click on it.
  • This will open the side menu. At the bottom of the menu, you will see several buttons arranged in a row. Among them, interact with the penultimate one with the gear icon.
  • This will open the settings menu. Here, go to the Personal tab.
  • On the left side of the menu, you will see a bunch of buttons arranged in two columns. Here, interact with the second button in the first column, which says Redeem Code.
  • This will open the redemption menu. There will be an input field and a blue Confirm button below it. Now, enter one of the working codes in the input field.
  • Finally, click on the blue Confirm button to submit your reward request.

If everything is done correctly, you will see a notification on the screen with a list of rewards received.

How to Get More The Legend Of Neverland Codes

The developers of this free mobile game publish codes on their official social media, so you should monitor these sources first. To save you time, here are the links to the official social media pages of The Legend Of Neverland.

  • Official The Legend Of Neverland Facebook page.
  • Official The Legend Of Neverland YouTube channel.

The Legend Of Neverland is available on mobile devices.

item.title: Silent Hill 2 Remake's James Is Almost Unbelievable in Combat
item.description:
Despite some initial concerns from longtime fans regarding the studio's handling of the project, the Silent Hill 2 remake is a resounding success for Bloober Team. Not only did the studio carefully thread the needle to deliver a remake that adheres to the original spirit and vision of Silent Hill 2 (including consulting with members from Team Silent who worked on the title), but it also deftly utilizes modern technology to add subtlety and nuance to the original's somewhat ham-fisted presentation. One area where Bloober Team took plenty of liberties with Silent Hill 2 's remake, though, is in its combat, resulting in an experience that borders on ludonarrative dissonance.

Originally coined by game designer Clint Hocking in reference to the disparity between a game's narrative elements and its interactive, or ludic, elements, ludonarrative dissonance occurs when a character or characters in a game behave mechanically counter to how players are supposed to perceive them in the context of the game's story. Make no mistake, combat in Silent Hill 2 's remake is vastly improved over the original, but the clunky controls and stiff movements of the original Silent Hill 2 were both a necessity and an intentional design choice that made more sense in the context of who protagonist James Sunderland is, with the remake erring more on the side of action-oriented survival horror.

Silent Hill 2 Remake Makes James Feel Powerful In a Way He Never Did Before

The age of the survival horror remake kicked off in earnest with the release of 2019's Resident Evil 2 , and since then, that game has served as the gold standard for how studios approach reimagining classic horror games from the 5th and 6th console generations. It comes as no surprise, then, that players can find a little bit of Resident Evil 2 's DNA within Silent Hill 2 's remake. However, where Leon Kennedy and Claire Redfield are both trained combatants with fighting experience, James Sunderland is not. In the Silent Hill 2 remake, his proficiency in combat contradicts the idea that he's just a normal guy stuck in an abnormal situation.

Between dealing more damage with weapons, having greater access to firearms and ammunition, and a new dodge move that grants invincibility upon use and has no stamina meter to throttle players' use of it, James Sunderland can handle himself more capably in the remake than he ever could in the original Silent Hill 2 . But James' ineptitude in the original was a combination of intentional design and technological limitation that forced players to weigh engaging with enemies. In the remake, there's no reason to not rush in and make short work of foes, even though it breaks the immersion a bit.

Despite Its Conflict With James' Characterization, Silent Hill 2 Remake's Combat is a Highlight

James Sunderland's place as an "everyman" aside, the improvements to Silent Hill 2 's combat in the remake are, by and large, positive. One area where this becomes painfully obvious is in the new boss encounters, which are a far cry from the often tedious and frustrating fights against bosses in the original Silent Hill 2 . Especially on higher difficulties where players have a razor-thin margin for error during these tense encounters, having an effective dodge ability that grants i-frames on each use is a welcome (if not slightly overpowered) maneuver to have in the arsenal against Silent Hill's nightmarish denizens.

As a whole, combat also feels more responsive and satisfying in the Silent Hill 2 remake, which is a blessing for the game's length and pacing considering the reimagining of the 2001 survival horror classic is practically double the length of the original. Had Bloober Team failed to stick the landing on the game's combat system, it would've spelled disaster for the highly anticipated remake of one of the most important 6th-generation games. Silent Hill 2 's James might feel like a bit of an action hero in the remake, but encounters are still challenging enough to where a brush with death is a normal occurrence in each and every fight.

item.title: Anthem Producer Wants to Reboot the Game
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • A former Anthem producer is interested in a reboot due to the game's untapped potential and diehard fan base.
  • Anthem was ultimately abandoned after failing to meet EA's expectations and receiving negative reviews.
  • While BioWare has moved on to other games like Dragon Age: The Veilguard, fans may still hope for an Anthem reboot.

One of the former Anthem producers has recently expressed interest in working on a reboot of the controversial multiplayer game. While Anthem is widely considered BioWare’s biggest failure, it seems the game still has some diehard fans.

Anthem was released in 2019, being considered a big departure for BioWare, which was mostly known for its big single-player RPGs. Coming on the heels of Mass Effect Andromeda , which had a mixed reception, it still managed to sell over 5 million copies, but it was not enough. Anthem failed to meet EA’s expectations and received mostly negative or neutral reviews, which essentially killed the game’s future. A project called Anthem Next was originally proposed by BioWare, but eventually canceled in 2020, and Anthem was mostly abandoned by all but a few gamers.

One of the Anthem producers, Ben Irving, has recently expressed interest in working on a reboot for the game. Irving, who is currently working at Crystal Dynamics, said that it’s amazing “how many people are still so enthusiastic about Anthem ” after so much time. In the comments of Irving’s post, several fans of BioWare’s multiplayer RPG agreed, arguing that Anthem suffered from a short development cycle and that the game had the potential to be great. However, it was not supported for enough time, and Anthem ended as a live service game that died too soon.

Former BioWare Producer Is Interested In an Anthem Reboot

This is not the first time a former BioWare employee has expressed interest in Anthem . Back in 2023, for example, Ian Saterdalen lamented that Anthem was created in only 15 months, which was not common for a game of such a large scope. Due to this problem, Saterdalen defended that Anthem 2 could have been great, but it never had a chance to exist.

While it’s not entirely uncommon to see developers mourning titles they have worked on before, it’s not very likely that Anthem will return in either a reboot or a sequel. Not only did the game receive harsh criticism when it was released, but BioWare has moved on. Dragon Age: The Veilguard has been receiving positive reviews ahead of its launch, and it’s clear that most gamers are happier with BioWare working on single-player games, not live service ones. For a possible Anthem reboot to have a chance, it would probably need to be developed by another company owned by EA. In any case, some Anthem fans will likely continue to wish for more in the game’s universe.

item.title: Fallout 76: The Best Places To Farm Ballistic Fiber
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Camp McClintock
    • Great For Lower Levels
  • Fort Defiance
    • A Popular Place To Farm For Higher Levels
  • The Thorn
    • An Old Military Outpost
  • The Most Sensational Game
    • The Expedition That Offers Ballistic Fiber
  • Farming Missile Silos
    • A High-Level Way To Get Ballistic Fiber
  • An Enemy Drop
    • Hunt For The Mothman
  • Buy Bulk Ballistic Fiber From Vendor Bots
    • Save Time, Spend Caps
  • Purchasing Ballistic Fiber From Other Players
    • Can Be A Rather Lucrative Way Of Getting Bulk Ballistic Fiber
  • Additional Locations
    • A Few Other Places To Stock Up On Ballistic Fiber

Gamers will need to find a ton of Ballistic Fiber to craft and repair endgame armor in Fallout 76 . Ballistic Fiber is a rare resource and can be difficult to collect if players don't know where to look. There are dozens of dedicated spawn locations for Ballistic Fiber on the map, but some are more fruitful than others.

Instead of listing all of the locations, this guide will cover the best ways to collect as much of the material as possible. By traveling to these locations and looting them a few times, survivors in Fallout 76 will have all the Fiber they need to craft and upgrade at the workbench.

Updated October 28, 2024 by Benjamin Joe: The last few months have been big for Fallout 76. From the release of the hit Fallout TV series to a whole slew of updates, the game has seen lots of new players load up and take on all that post-war Appalachia has to offer. While there haven't been any changes made toward obtaining ballistic fiber, there was one method that was left out of the original article; buying it from players.

Purchasing ballistic fiber from players is a great way to stock up on this valuable resource. So, this article needed to be updated to show how to trade and find players who are willing to part ways with some of their excess ballistic fiber.

Camp McClintock

Great For Lower Levels

This area, which is just north of the Charleston Capitol, has a total of six Military Ammo Bags, as well as two Military Duct Tape. Use one of the game's best builds to farm this area without any of the local monsters being able to impede. Every Military Duct Tape scrapped by the player provides them with two Ballistic Fiber. Players also get two Ballistic Fiber when scrapping a Military Ammo Bag. These items offer the most Ballistic Fiber with the exclusion of Bulk Ballistic Fiber.

Camp McClintock is the best place to go for low-level players. Most players will have already visited this location as it plays an important part in the main storyline. But, for those who haven't yet been here, it's an easy place to navigate with very few enemies, making it the best place to go if you are relatively new to the game.

To find all of the Ballistic Fiber in this area, simply follow the steps below:

  • Bag 1 : Enter the building from the North. It will be in the open locker to the right.
  • Bag 2 : Go left from the entrance. It is on the desk beneath the Quartermaster sign.
  • Bag 3 : Instead of entering the building, head southwest to the tin buildings (Barracks) denoted by a flag. It is at the back of the building, to the left of the flag.
  • Bag 4 : In the tank by the Barracks.
  • Bag 5 : Head southwest from the fast travel location until the isolated cabin appears. It will be on the cabin floor.
  • Bag 6 : Same location as bag 5.
  • Duct Tape 1 : Walk up the stairs and take a left. It is on the wooden stand next to the metal shelf.
  • Duct Tape 2 : At the Barracks entrance in the same building as Bag 3.

Total Ballistic Fibers at this location: 16

Fort Defiance

A Popular Place To Farm For Higher Levels

Fort Defiance has the most ammo bags of any location on the map. There are a total of nine bags in the general area, but sadly, there is no Military Grade Duct Tape at the fort. Lose any impractical armor sets to avoid getting torn apart by the opponents here.

Follow the instructions below to collect each one. Gamers will want to enter through the blue double doors on the west side of the Fort.

To gather all these bags, players will need to progress through the Fort Defiance mission in the storyline. Once inside, press the red button, and head into the restricted area. Areas like this are fun to explore. Some gamers would say it makes the game worth playing even today. Just keep in mind that there are usually quite a few enemies inside this building, so proceed with caution.

  • Bags 1&2 : Walk to the end of the hall, make a right, and use the ramp to access the second floor. Jump on the ledge to the south and enter the small room to the west. It will be on the shelf.
  • Bag 3 : After leaving the room above, walk to the north through the hole in the wall to an identical room. It will be on the shelf in that room.
  • Bag 4 : Instead of jumping on the ledge, continue north after walking up the ramp. Walk through the door on the right, and it will be in the first room to the northeast.
  • Bag 5 : Leave the room, take a right (north), and walk up the stairs. Walk to the end of the hall through the right door, which will be in the first room on the left, across from the white refrigerator.
  • Bag 6 : Make a left from the elevator. It will be inside the first door on the right.
  • Bag 7 : The next ammo bag is right between the two bunkbeds in the same room.
  • Bag 8 : Leave the room, take a right, and enter the room on the right at the end of the hall. In the room to the right, the bag is on the bottom shelf.
  • Bag 9 : The final bag is on the box in that same room.

Total Ballistic Fibers at this location: 18

The Thorn

An Old Military Outpost

Due north from Fort Defiance, there are three more ammo bags and one Military Duct tape. With fierce enemies around, this may not be the best game to get drunk in.

At the camp, the first bag is inside the tent. In the center of the camp, there is yet another bag right next to a body. The final bag is on the bottom of a shelf on the northwest end of the camp. To the left of the shelf is the Military Duct Tape.

Total Ballistic Fiber at this location: 8.

After looting all three of these locations, gamers will have roughly 42 Ballistic Fiber. If that is not enough, there are three more bags and another piece of Military Duct Tape at Forward Station Alpha in the hills to the northeast. Finally, players should have enough Ballistic Fiber to meet all of their high-end crafting needs. The game has many improvements it needs to make, so having extra Ballistic Fiber around for potential upgrades on the horizon is a wise decision.

The Most Sensational Game

The Expedition That Offers Ballistic Fiber

When playing with friends, it is possible to farm an unlimited amount of Ballistic Fiber from the expedition The Most Sensational Game. This expedition is considered to be the best expedition in the game. It can be a bit of a grind, but for those with some patience, it can really pay off.

To do this multiple times, the player will need to be on a team with a friend. Upon loading in, players will be prompted to talk to the Batsuuri Twins. Next to the Batsuuri Twins, there are three Military Ammo Bags. The team leader mustn't pick up the Military Ammo Bags. If they do, then the bags will not spawn back in during the next expedition.

Any player aside from the team leader can pick up the Military Ammo Bags. Then, complete the expedition as normal. After completing the expedition, the team leader should begin a new expedition, and more bags should spawn back in.

Players can repeat this process as often as they like. It's worth talking with a friend and then splitting the loot after a few runs. This can be a very profitable way to farm Ballistic Fiber.

Farming Missile Silos

A High-Level Way To Get Ballistic Fiber

There are three missile silos in Fallout 76; Site Alpha, Site Bravo, and Site Charlie. Players will need to run through a missile silo to launch a nuke. Launching nukes plays a big part in the game. In fact, it's the center point of the main storyline.

The interior of all three missile silos is the same, so it doesn't really matter which one the player goes to. Dotted throughout the silos, players will come across several Ammo Bags. These bags are scattered throughout each silo. Not only that but there is a gym inside each silo that contains lots of weights that can be broken down for lead. Since lead is required for crafting most standard ammo types, it may be worth grabbing the weights while scavenging for Ammo Bags.

There is also a chance of finding some extra Ballistic Fiber inside desk drawers that can be found throughout each missile silo.

An Enemy Drop

Hunt For The Mothman

Most enemies in Fallout 76 will drop certain items upon death. Deathclaws drop Black Titanium, Wendigos drop screws, and the Mothman will drop Ballistic Fiber. While it can be a little time-consuming hunting down a Mothman, when killed, players will be able to pick up a Torn Mothman Wing from its corpse. This can be broken down into 2 Acid and 1 Ballistic Fiber. While it isn't much, it is better than nothing.

While finding a Mothman can be tricky, there are a few locations that can potentially spawn a Mothman encounter:

  • Kanawha County Cemetery
  • Blake's Offering
  • Lucky Hole Mine
  • Camp Venture
  • Point Pleasant
  • Moth-Home
  • Sacrament

There are other locations where players may encounter a Mothman, but the ones listed above tend to be the more fruitful locations to visit. It's also worth noting that the Mothman will only appear at night.

Buy Bulk Ballistic Fiber From Vendor Bots

Save Time, Spend Caps

Ballistic Fiber isn't cheap. That said, high-level players usually find it pretty easy to make Caps in Fallout 76. For those looking to save some time, it may be worth paying the Caps and buying Bulk Ballistic Fiber from Vendor Bots dotted around Appalachia.

Not every Vendor Bot will have Bulk Ballistic Fiber for sale. To maximize the chance of finding some, head to the Whitespring Mall. Here, there are lots of vendors that players can trade with. Some of them will have Bulk Ballistic Fiber for sale.

By switching to a new server after trading with the Vendor Bots, the items that the Bots have for sale will be different. So, by server hopping, players can find an almost unlimited amount of Bulk Ballistic Fiber for their repairing needs .

Purchasing Ballistic Fiber From Other Players

Can Be A Rather Lucrative Way Of Getting Bulk Ballistic Fiber

There's a large trading community behind Fallout 76. There are places on both Reddit and Discord that are dedicated to player trading. While there are a handful of scammers out there, there are also lots of honest players who are always more than happy to set up a trade. For players who don't want to run the risk of getting scammed, there are couriers that they can use through Reddit that will act as a middleman during the trade.

If the player doesn't want to trade through third-party sites, then there is another option, vendor hopping. Every server is filled with player CAMPS. Most of them have things that players can purchase. While there's no guarantee that a player is selling Ballistic Fiber, if they have junk items for sale, there's always a chance that they might have some Ballistic Fiber listed in their vendors . Players who have some spare Caps to spend can hop from server to server in the hopes of finding a CAMP Vendor with some Ballistic Fiber inside.

Also, if players are really desperate, then they can try to approach players directly and trade with them. While not all players will want to trade, some will be more than willing to let the player browse their inventory. More often than not, players will have a handful of junk items in their inventory. The chances of a player having a lot of it on their character are slim, but in desperate times, a small amount of Ballistic Fiber can be just enough for one's needs.

Additional Locations

A Few Other Places To Stock Up On Ballistic Fiber

Anyone desperate for even more can find additional materials in the following locations. The game's iconic power armor will be happy for the extra upgrades applied by Ballistic Fiber.

  • Abbie's Bunker : 1 Ammo Bag
  • Camp Venture : 1 Ammo Bag
  • Clancy Manor : 3 Military Grade Duct Tape
  • Converted Munitions Factory : 1 Ballistic Fiber Scrap
  • Firebase Hancock : 2 Ammo Bags and 1 Military Grade Duct Tape
  • Firebase LT : 2 Ammo Bags
  • Forward Station Alpha : 1 Ammo Bag
  • Monogah Power Plant : 2 Ammo Bags
  • National Radio Astronomy Research Center : 2 Military Grade Duct Tape
  • Relay Tower EM-B1-27 : 2 Ammo Bags
  • Sons Of Dane : 2 Ammo Bags
  • Watoga Civic Center : 1 Ammo Bag

This list is by no means comprehensive, but it covers known locations that will contain enough materials to craft any item that lists Ballistic Fiber as a necessary ingredient. Updates add areas to the game that might sometimes contain Ballistic Fiber. Just like the additional Ballistic Fiber added with The Most Sensational Game Expedition. These components can be found and looted all over the map. These are simply the highest-density areas of Ballistic Fiber materials around. For the best results, combine all the information from the list above with a general taste for grabbing every item you see while exploring.

item.title: Incredible Fan-Made Video Shows Skull Kid Joining the Super Smash Bros. Roster
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • A fan-made trailer shows what it would look like if the Skull Kid from The Legend of Zelda: Majora's Mask was added to the Super Smash Bros. roster.
  • Many Zelda characters have appeared in past entries to the franchise, including Princess Zelda and Ganondorf.
  • The Skull Kid has already appeared in later Super Smash Bros. games as a collectible and Assist Trophy.

An impressive, fan-made trailer is giving players a look at what it would be like if the Skull Kid from The Legend of Zelda joined the already massive Super Smash Bros. roster. The long-running Super Smash Bros. series celebrates many of Nintendo’s beloved gaming franchises, with mascots from across the Big N’s library battling it out in colorful platforming brawls.

Arguably Nintendo’s second-biggest franchise after Super Mario Bros , The Legend of Zelda has seen plenty of representation throughout the Super Smash Bros. series. While the original Nintendo 64 entry only featured main protagonist Link among its 12 combatants, later installments would introduce Princess Zelda (as well as her Ocarina of Time alter-ego Sheik), the dreaded Ganondorf, and two alternate versions of Link in Ocarina of Time ’s Young Link and The Wind Waker ’s cel-shaded Toon Link. Some of The Legend of Zelda ’s most iconic locations have also been included as stages, such as Hyrule Castle and the Great Bay from Majora’s Mask .

A talented animator by the YouTube handle of King Bob recently imagined another famous element of 2000’s The Legend of Zelda: Majora’s Mask making its way into Super Smash Bros. through a stunning fan-made concept trailer. The video opens with the villainous Skull Kid cackling in front of a burning forest before cutting to an eclipse above the Mushroom Kingdom. As the rest of the Super Smash Bros. Ultimate roster looks on in horror, the moon from Majora’s Mask falls from the sky, heralding the Skull Kid’s arrival as a new playable character.

Skull Kid Clocks Into Super Smash Bros. in Stunning Fan Trailer

The Super Smash Bros. fan trailer then cuts to the famous Clock Tower from The Legend of Zelda: Majora’s Mask , where the Skull Kid finally emerges to battle the likes of Young Link, the Mario Brothers, and Isabelle from Animal Crossing . One by one, the Skull Kid uses his magic to transform his enemies into lifeless Deku-like trees before the scene transitions to mock gameplay footage of Skull Kid battling various characters using magical attacks. The trailer ultimately ends the same as the more official Super Smash Bros. Ultimate character reveal trailers: with a message stating that the Skull Kid is “clocking in” as the newest Super Smash Bros. competitor.

In addition to featuring impressive graphics, King Bob’s Super Smash Bros. concept trailer for Majora's Mask 's Skull Kid is quite cinematic, presenting the character as a slasher villain whose mere presence is a sign of bad tidings for the rest of the roster. The Skull Kid has already appeared in later Super Smash Bros. games as a collectible and Assist Trophy, and this fan-made trailer makes a solid case for the brainwashed forest goblin to be added as a fully playable character in a future installment.
